    ", we give another characterization for the cohen - macaulay property in terms of the index of nilpotency @xmath27 and the reduction number @xmath28 , where @xmath29 is a principal reduction of @xmath30 .",

    "in this section , we want to prove the following main result by studying the standard basis of the corresponding defining ideal .",
    "[ d4 ] let the numerical semigroup @xmath469 be minimally generated by 4 elements . if the associated graded ring @xmath26 is gorenstein , then for every @xmath120 , @xmath470 .",
    "the proof of the above theorem depends heavily on an important result by bresinsky @xcite :    [ bremain ] let @xmath469 be a symmetric numerical semigroup , minimally generated by 4 elements . then up to a permutation of generators",

    "[ fact18.1.19 ] let @xmath476 $ ] be a polynomial ring of dimension @xmath0 over the field @xmath11 .",
    "let @xmath477 be the graded maximal ideal of @xmath194 .",
    "if an @xmath194-ideal @xmath193 is @xmath30-primary , monomial and gorenstein , then it is generated by pure powers of the form @xmath478 .",
    "the proof is an easy application of linkage theory .",
    "when the ideal is gorenstein , one can use the generators that are pure powers to generate a link .",
    "the resulting quotient ideal is an almost complete intersection and monomial .",
    "now use the same pure powers to generate a new link , and we shall get the original monomial ideal . but it will be easy to see that for an almost complete intersection monomial ideal , this link has to be generated by pure powers . see @xcite for related discussion .    as a generalization of the above idea",
    ", we can prove the following :    [ lem4.4 ] let ideal @xmath479 $ ] be generated by @xmath480 and a finite collection of monomials .",
    "if @xmath481 and @xmath482 is gorenstein , then @xmath482 is generated by up to 5 elements .    in the following ,",

    "since it is a pure power in @xmath354 , the initial form ideal @xmath24 has to be a complete intersection after modulo @xmath188 .",

    "this gives a contradiction .",

    "[ just5 ] in case iii of [ bremain ] , if @xmath26 is gorenstein , then the initial form ideal @xmath24 is 5-generated .",
    "the converse of [ just5 ] is not true .",
    "for instance in case 1(a ) of [ nec - is - suf ] , when @xmath26 is cohen - macaulay , @xmath24 is 5-generated .",
    "but it can never be gorenstein by [ mythm1 ] .",
    "the author wishes to thank bernd ulrich for the helpful suggestions throughout the preparation of this paper .",
    "also , the author wishes to thank william heinzer for the warm encouragement and helpful comments .",
    "he wants to acknowledge the support provided by singular @xcite and gap @xcite . in particular , he thanks lance bryant for the many helpful conversations and for the singular library that facilitates the computations of initial form ideals .",
    "here we use the standard basis method to give a strict proof of formula . without loss of generality",
    ", we can assume that @xmath872 , @xmath873 and @xmath874 .",
    "consider the following monomials and binomials in @xmath875 $ ] with lexicographical monomial ordering .",
    "@xmath876 the following table shows that every s - polynomial @xmath877 is either @xmath878 or can be reduced by some @xmath879 . by symmetry , we only need to consider for @xmath271 .       since @xmath880 , @xmath881 , @xmath882 , @xmath883 , @xmath884 and @xmath885 , we know immediately that the set @xmath886 forms a standard basis for @xmath887 .",
    "hence by @xcite , the intersection ideal is @xmath888 and by @xcite , the quotient ideal is @xmath889"
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> in this paper , we study the tangent cone of numerical semigroup rings with small embedding dimension @xmath0 . for @xmath1 , </S>",
    "<S> we give characterizations of the buchsbaum and cohen - macaulay properties and for @xmath2 , we give a characterization of the gorenstein property . </S>",
    "<S> in particular , when @xmath2 and the tangent cone is gorenstein , the initial form ideal of the defining ideal is 5-generated . </S>"
  ]
}
